itemList.text: docker build -t gcr.io/${PROJECT_ID}/hello-app:v1 . - build the image using the Dockerfile in the current directory and tag it with a name, such as gcr.io/my-project/hello-app:v1. The gcr.io prefix refers to Google Container Registry, where the image will be hosted. Running this command does not upload the image yet

docker push gcr.io/${PROJECT_ID}/hello-app:v1 - upload the image to your Container Registry. You may need to authenticate to Container Registry (you need to run this only once) using gcloud auth configure-docker
docker run --rm -p 8080:8080 gcr.io/${PROJECT_ID}/hello-app:v1 - --rm tell Docker daemon that when exit, erase everything related to it and save the disk space
